meanings.definition: A person or thing serving as a typical example or excellent model.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was an exemplar of kindness and patience.
meanings.sent2: She studied the exemplar to learn how to be a better leader.
meanings.sent3: The cat, an exemplar of laziness, refused to chase the mouse.
meanings.sent4: His artwork was an exemplar of creativity and originality.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree stood as an exemplar of strength and resilience.

meanings.definition: A copy or model that is to be imitated.
meanings.sent1: The student created an exemplar of the project for others to follow.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer used the exemplar to create a new collection.
meanings.sent3: The robot, an exemplar of efficiency, completed the task in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her success story became an exemplar for aspiring entrepreneurs.
meanings.sent5: The recipe book provided an exemplar for baking the perfect cake.
